snippet: The results of a small study of children with mild autism given oxytocin suggests that their brains’ social regions are not irrevocably damaged.
abstract: Study in Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences finds that hormone oxytocin, when administered to children with autism, can generate increased brain activity in region associated with social connections.
lead_paragraph: The results of a small study of children with mild autism given oxytocin suggests that their brains’ social regions are not irrevocably damaged.

headline.main: Oxytocin Found to Stimulate Social Brain Regions in Children With Autism
headline.print_headline: Oxytocin Found to Stimulate Social Brain Regions in Children With Autism
